meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by using persuasion or guile.
meanings.sent1: She managed to blag her way into the concert without a ticket.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to blag extra snacks from his friends during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox blagged some extra berries from the unsuspecting rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The smooth-talking salesman could blag a deal out of anyone.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to blag her way out of trouble was truly impressive.

meanings.sent1: The blag at the jewelry store shocked the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The police were investigating a series of blags in the area.
meanings.sent3: The daring blag of the famous painting left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent4: The mastermind behind the blag had planned every detail meticulously.
meanings.sent5: The news of the blag spread quickly through the small town.

meanings.sent1: His elaborate blag fooled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The magician's blag left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: She pulled off a hilarious blag on her unsuspecting brother.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's latest blag was his most daring yet.
meanings.sent5: The clever detective saw through the criminal's blag immediately.
